questions.question: Determine the partitions of the set ${3, 4, 5, 6, 7}$ from the following subsets.

explanations.a: : {3,5}, {3,6,7}, {4,5,6}. It is not a partition because these sets are not pairwise disjoint. The elements 3, 5 and 6 appear repeatedly these sets.
explanations.b: {3}, {4,6}, {5}, {7} this is a partition as they are pairwise disjoint
explanations.c: {3,4,6}, {7} this is not a partition as element 5 is missing.
explanations.d: {5,6}, {5,7} this is not a partition because it is missing the elements 3, 4 in any of the sets.

questions.question: Consider the congruence $45 \equiv 3$ (mod 7). Find the set of equivalence class representatives.

explanations.a: Note that a set of class representatives is the subset of a set which contains exactly one element from each equivalence class. Now, for integers n, a and b, we have congruence a≡b(mod n), then the set of equivalence classes are {…, -2n, -n, 0, n, 2n,…}, {…, 1-2n, 1-n, 1, 1+n, 1+2n,…}. The required answer is {…, 0, 7, 14, 28, …}.
